item.title: Using Linux’s memfd_secret syscall from the JVM with JEP-419
item.author: brice.dutheil@gmail.com (Brice Dutheil)
item.description: Linux 5.14 brought a new system call memfd_secret in order to mitigate speculative attack by preventing the kernel from being able to peek at these memory segments. Let’s use this syscall from the JVM with the JEP-419 API.
